describe: Cambodia, located in Southeast Asia, is known for its rich history, vibrant culture, and stunning landscapes. It is home to the magnificent Angkor Wat, a UNESCO World Heritage site, and offers a blend of ancient temples, bustling cities, and serene countryside.

cities.name: üè∞ Phnom Penh
cities.geographical_location: Located at the confluence of the Mekong and Tonle Sap rivers in the south-central region of Cambodia.
cities.climate: Tropical wet and dry climate with a distinct monsoon season.
cities.famous_cuisine: Amok trey (fish amok), Kuy teav (noodle soup), and Bai sach chrouk (pork and rice).

cities.name: üåÜ Siem Reap
cities.geographical_location: Located in northwestern Cambodia, close to the Angkor archaeological site.
cities.climate: Tropical wet and dry climate with a pronounced dry season.
cities.famous_cuisine: Lok lak (stir-fried beef), Nom banh chok (Khmer noodles), and Prahok ktis (fermented fish dip).

cities.name: üèù Sihanoukville
cities.geographical_location: Located on the Gulf of Thailand in the southwest of Cambodia.
cities.climate: Tropical monsoon climate with heavy rainfall during the wet season.
cities.famous_cuisine: Grilled seafood, Samlor machu (sour soup), and Mee katang (stir-fried noodles).
